doc.title: Teams.txt
doc.text: Via the Teams.txt component you can specify in which way groups of players play with or against together in multiplayer melees. From 4.9.6.0 CR.

row.col: 0 or 1. If 0, no teams exist and it is assumed that no teams can be formed at runtime. This also means that no hostility options will be available in the player menu.
0 or 1. If 1, players can declare hostility or alliance at runtime.
0 if Teams.txt is present. 1 if Teams.txt is not present but the melee rule is active.
0 or 1. If 1, players can choose a different team at runtime.
0 or 1. If 1, players can declare hostility or alliance at runtime.
0 is there are team sections present. 1 if there are none.

Player distribution to the teams. Possible values are: Free (free choice), Host (the host chooses during lobby), Random (random distribution) or RandomInv (random distribution, but not displayed during lobby).
0 or 1. If 1, all players of a team are assigned the same color.
Maximum number of script players which the host can activate in the lobby of network games. This includes script players that have already joined.
A list of names separated by "|" which are assigned to script players joinging in the lobby. If no list of names is provided, all script players are called "Computer".
Identifier: a unique number greater than 0 which can be used to identify a team in scenario scripts. Usually you can simply use ascending numerical values as team identifiers.
Team name. You can also specify localized strings such as $TeamRight$. See Localization.

If not 0, all members of this team use the corresponding [PlayerX] section in Scenario.txt for starting conditions. If 0, starting conditions are assigned automatically and independent of team membership.
32 bit RGB value of the team color. The team color is used instead of the player color if TeamColors is set.
Specifies a team icon for runtime joins or non-network games.
Maximum number of players who may join this team. 0 for infinite.
